name.baseName: Extraction Stage ; Oil ; Utilizing carbon dioxide Reservoir Extraction, Treatment, and Separation
开采阶段;石油;利用二氧化碳油藏提取处理分离

dataSetInformation.common:generalComment: This industrial process is intended for use in enhanced oil recovery (EOR) operations. Specifically, it is applied within the petroleum industry for extracting oil from the San Andres dolomite reservoirs in the Permian Basin of West Texas. The process includes the utilization of CO2 for long-term storage and additional oil extraction after initial waterflooding, where CO2 serves as a miscible gas to increase the recovery of oil from reservoirs with certain characteristics such as porosity, permeability, and depth.
该工业流程用于加强油田回收（EOR）操作。具体来说，它适用于石油工业从德克萨斯州西部二叠纪盆地的圣安德烈斯白云岩油藏中提取石油。该过程包括利用二氧化碳进行长期储存和初步水驱后的额外石油提取，其中二氧化碳作为互溶气体用于增加具有特定特性（如孔隙度、渗透率和深度）油藏的石油回收率。

locationOfOperationSupplyOrProduction.descriptionOfRestrictions: the Permian Basin of West Texas,Although all emissions and discharges should be included in a full LCA, this study focused on greenhouse gas emissions (CO2, CH4, and N2O) only. The analysis was limited to the boundary of the facility and included the extraction of the oil and associated gas from the oil reservoir, the processing of the associated gas for separation of the different components (water, hydrogen sulfide -H2S, CO2, CH4, natural gas liquids), the compression of the separated CO2 stream destined for injection, and the transport and injection of the CO2 in the oil reservoir for extraction of additional oil and for long-term storage. Figure 1 shows a schematic of this process. The extraction and transport of the CO2 from the natural reservoir is not part of the analysis.The reservoir we investigated in this study is situated in the Permian Basin of West Texas. It is a layered dolomite with an average porosity of 8.5% and an average permeability of 1.5 md. Production is from the San Andres dolomite at an average depth of 1585 m, and the thickness of the producing layer varies from 15 to 70 m. The unit contains 13 130 producing acres, which have already undergone waterflooding and are now under enhanced oil recovery production using CO2. The minimum miscibility pressure to be maintained for injection of CO2 is 85 atm
德克萨斯州西部的二叠纪盆地,这是一种层状白云岩，平均孔隙度为8.5%，平均渗透率为1.5 md。产层来自圣安德烈斯白云岩，平均深度为1585 m，产层厚度为15 ~ 70 m。该单元占地13130英亩，已经进行了水驱，

technology.technologyDescriptionAndIncludedProcesse: Chemicals. CO2-based synthetic fuels may refer to methane, methanol, gasoline, and aviation fuels. CO2 captured at power plant exhausts could be used directly in catalytic processes for the generation of synthetic gas. Syngas, as a mixture of CO and H2, is a crucial component in the production of hydrogen, ammonia, methanol, and synthetic hydrocarbon fuels. As an intermediate, it can be used in the production of synthetic petroleum by the Fischer–Tropsch process [1,16].
化学物质以二氧化碳为基础的合成燃料可能是指甲烷、甲醇、汽油和航空燃料。从电厂废气中捕获的二氧化碳可以直接用于催化合成气体的生成过程。合成气，作为CO和氢气的混合物，是至关重要的是生产氢、氨、甲醇和合成烃的原料燃料。作为一种中间体，它可以用于合成石油的生产费托过。
technology.technologicalApplicability: This industrial process is intended for use in enhanced oil recovery (EOR) operations. Specifically, it is applied within the petroleum industry for extracting oil from the San Andres dolomite reservoirs in the Permian Basin of West Texas. The process includes the utilization of CO2 for long-term storage and additional oil extraction after initial waterflooding, where CO2 serves as a miscible gas to increase the recovery of oil from reservoirs with certain characteristics such as porosity, permeability, and depth.
该工业流程用于加强油田回收（EOR）操作。具体来说，它适用于石油工业从德克萨斯州西部二叠纪盆地的圣安德烈斯白云岩油藏中提取石油。该过程包括利用二氧化碳进行长期储存和初步水驱后的额外石油提取，其中二氧化碳作为互溶气体用于增加具有特定特性（如孔隙度、渗透率和深度）油藏的石油回收率。

referenceToDataSource.common:shortDescription: Aycaguer, A.-C., Lev-On, M., & Winer, A. M. (2001). Reducing Carbon Dioxide Emissions with Enhanced Oil Recovery Projects: A Life Cycle Assessment Approach. Energy & Fuels, 15(2), 303–308.
Aycaguer, A.-C., Lev-On, M., & Winer, A. M. (2001). Reducing Carbon Dioxide Emissions with Enhanced Oil Recovery Projects: A Life Cycle Assessment Approach. Energy & Fuels, 15(2), 303–308.

dataSourcesTreatmentAndRepresentativenes.useAdviceForDataSet: When using this data set for life cycle assessment, it is crucial to include all emissions and discharges in order to achieve a comprehensive view, even though this particular study focuses on greenhouse gas emissions (CO2, CH4, N2O) solely. Users should strictly delimit the system's boundaries to the facility in question, encompassing oil extraction, gas processing, and the associated transport and injection operations for CO2. The unit's geological characteristics, such as porosity and permeability, along with the minimum miscibility pressure for CO2 injection, which is 85 atm, should also be factored into the assessment. The transport of CO2 from external sources to the reservoir is not covered in this dataset and should be considered separately if applicable.

在使用该数据集进行生命周期评估时，尽管本研究专注于温室气体排放（二氧化碳CO2、甲烷CH4和氧化亚氮N2O）的研究，重要的是要包括所有排放和排放以获得全面的视角。用户应严格限定系统边界到所述设施，涵盖石油提取、气体处理，以及与二氧化碳运输和注入相关的操作。单元的地质特性，如孔隙度和渗透性以及二氧化碳注入的最小混溶压力（85大气压）也应纳入评估中。数据集不包括从外部源头到油藏的二氧化碳运输，如果适用，应单独考虑。

review.common:reviewDetails: Inventory: The internal review was done by several iteration steps concerning raw data validation, raw data documentation, representativity, completeness and consistency of modelling with regard to ISO 14040 and 14044.
清单： 内部审查通过几个迭代步骤完成，涉及原始数据验证、原始数据记录、代表性、完整性、与 ISO 14040 和 14044 有关的建模的一致性。

publicationAndOwnership.common:licenseType: Free of charge for all users and uses

exchange.generalComment: The amount of oil recovered, specific to each reservoir, depends on the percentage of pore space occupied by oil and the expected pore space swept by carbon dioxide.
石油回收量，具体到每个储层，这取决于石油占用的孔隙空间的百分比，以及预计被二氧化碳扫过的孔隙空间。

There was no discussion on the performance of CO2 mixed phase production process, nor was there special consideration given to the problems caused by injecting acidic gas into the formation. The amount of carbon dioxide that needs to be injected is the expected cumulative carbon dioxide utilization rate, representing the past daily injection amount and future daily predictions, standardized as the 40 year lifecycle of the EOR oil production project. This quantity is important because it shows how much carbon dioxide needs to be supplied during the oil recovery process. It ultimately emphasizes the demand for carbon dioxide in projects aimed at improving oil recovery,
没有讨论CO2混相生产过程的性能，也没有特别考虑在地层中注入酸性气体所引起的问题。需要注入的二氧化碳量，是预期的累积二氧化碳利用率，代表了过去每天的注入量和未来每天的预测，标准化为该EOR石油生产项目40年的生命周期。这个量很重要，因为它显示了在采油过程中需要供应多少二氧化碳。它最终强调了提高采收率项目对二氧化碳的需求，原文未区分bio和fossil，根据专家判断此处为fossil
The amount of carbon dioxide emitted
排放的二氧化碳量,原文未区分bio和fossil，根据专家判断此处为fossil
